page.title: 07EDUCATION : STATE & ROEDEAN
page.content: In the Kemptown, Whitehawk & Ovingdean area there are a number of schools. Queens Park, St.Mark's & St.Johns mainly catering for the younger children; Hamilton Lodge in Kemptown & Ovingdean Hall specialist in educating the severely hard of hearing. There are only two comprehensive schools, Longhill & Stanley Deason which cover a large number of pupils. Then there are also three Public schools - Brighton College, St.Mary's Hall for girls and Roedean School.Roedean School is beautifully situated on the cliff tops just out of Brighton & is considered to be one of the country's top girls' schools. Once fees were so expensive that it only attracted the very priviliged but now it competes with other similar schools & has a cross section of girls who follow a wide variety of courses & activities.
